docs.snippet: AMONG recent currency happenings was the total obliteration of a unit that had been for centuries the money of account for more than 300,000,000 people. Without benefit of headlines, conferences or recriminations, noted only in agate type in tables...
docs.lead_paragraph: AMONG recent currency happenings was the total obliteration of a unit that had been for centuries the money of account for more than 300,000,000 people. Without benefit of headlines, conferences or recriminations, noted only in agate type in tables of foreign exchange, the ancient Chinese tael, and with it the candareen -- both part of the romantic record of the logs of the earliest voyagers to Cathay -- vanished from quotations and authorized use.

headline.main: CHINA, IN DESERTING THE TAEL, JOINS A MOTLEY DOLLAR GROUP

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 14. -- President Terra's junta approved today a Constitution project to submit to the contemplated Constituent Assembly providing for the establishment of a parliamentary form of government instead of the modified Swiss...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 14. -- President Terra's junta approved today a Constitution project to submit to the contemplated Constituent Assembly providing for the establishment of a parliamentary form of government instead of the modified Swiss commission form which Dr. Terra, recently overthrew.

headline.main: URUGUAY ANS DRAFT NEW CONSTITUTION; Junta Outlines Parliamentary Government to Replace Commission Form.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 15 -- Secretary Hull sounded a warning today that the world as a whole will gravitate toward bankruptcy unless the principal topics on the agenda of the World Economic Conference are dealt with in a fundamental way without delay.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 15 -- Secretary Hull sounded a warning today that the world as a whole will gravitate toward bankruptcy unless the principal topics on the agenda of the World Economic Conference are dealt with in a fundamental way without delay.
docs.abstract: Hull says world bankruptcy is near unless topics on agenda are dealt with without delay; confers with foreign Ambs in Wash

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 16. -- For four hours late today the three principal silver-producing countries of the world discussed at the State Department, through their representatives, possible modes of combined action at the London economic conference to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 16. -- For four hours late today the three principal silver-producing countries of the world discussed at the State Department, through their representatives, possible modes of combined action at the London economic conference to stabilize the international exchange value of silver.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 16. -- One aspect of the President's plea to the world for peace through disarmament is the incidental reminder that, of the fifty-five nations concerned with the Geneva and London conferences, nineteen still retain a monarchical or...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 16. -- One aspect of the President's plea to the world for peace through disarmament is the incidental reminder that, of the fifty-five nations concerned with the Geneva and London conferences, nineteen still retain a monarchical or semi-monarchical system.

headline.main: Roosevelt Peace Plea Went Chiefly to Democracies
DOLLAR CONTINUES GAIN.; Only German Marks Improve In Foreign Exchange Against It.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 18. -- President von Hindenburg of Germany, in replying today to President Roosevelt's appeal for peace, voiced sentiments expressed before the Reichstag yesterday by Chancellor Hitler. The German President's reply and those of other...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 18. -- President von Hindenburg of Germany, in replying today to President Roosevelt's appeal for peace, voiced sentiments expressed before the Reichstag yesterday by Chancellor Hitler. The German President's reply and those of other government heads were made public by the White House.

headline.main: HINDENBURG BACKS ROOSEVELT'S AIMS; Replies to President That His Message Won Approval Throughout Germany. ITALY ALSO SENDS PRAISE Spain, Uruguay, Nicaragua, Chile and Venezuela Among Others to Endorse Plan.
